transportAdvice: Prague has an extensive public transit network including metro, trams, and buses that covers virtually all tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The historic city centre is highly walkable, and taxis are widely available, though it is advisable to use metered cabs or pre-arranged services to avoid overcharging.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional snow or freezing rain; heavy layers are essential.
Still cold and wintry, though daylight begins to increase noticeably toward month end.
Early spring brings mild days but cold nights; expect variable conditions and occasional showers.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming trees; light jacket recommended for cooler evenings.
Warm and green with longer days; one of the most enjoyable months to visit Prague.
Warm summer weather with occasional afternoon thunderstorms; outdoor terraces are in full swing.
The warmest month of the year; busy with tourists and occasional heavy summer storms.
Hot and lively with peak tourist crowds; thunderstorms possible but generally sunny.
Early autumn brings cooler, comfortable temperatures and fewer crowds than summer.
Noticeably cooler with autumn foliage; misty mornings and increasing cloud cover are common.
Cold and often overcast; the city begins its transition toward the festive Christmas market season.
Cold and atmospheric with famous Christmas markets; snow is possible and adds to the charm.
